private_information: Role: model the Attack action and its logical preconditions and effects.
Attack preconditions: Province object, Planet object, Harmony must be true.
Attack positive effects: Pain object becomes true.
Attack negative effects: Province object, Planet object, Harmony become false after Attack.
attacker_agent.goal: Achieve the global goal: have object b craves object c and object c craves object d.

private_information: Role: model the Feast action and its logical preconditions and effects.
Feast preconditions: Object Craves other object, Province object, Harmony must be true.
Feast positive effects: Pain object becomes true and Province other object becomes true after Feast.
Feast negative effects: Object Craves other object, Province object, Harmony become false after Feast.
feaster_agent.goal: Achieve the global goal: have object b craves object c and object c craves object d.

private_information: Role: model the Succumb action and its logical preconditions and effects.
Succumb preconditions: Pain object must be true.
Succumb positive effects: Province object, Planet object, Harmony become true after Succumb.
Succumb negative effects: Pain object becomes false after Succumb.
succumber_agent.goal: Achieve the global goal: have object b craves object c and object c craves object d.

private_information: Role: model the Overcome action and its logical preconditions and effects.
Overcome preconditions: Province other object and Pain object must be true.
Overcome positive effects: Harmony becomes true, Province object becomes true, and Object Craves other object becomes true after Overcome.
Overcome negative effects: Province other object and Pain object become false after Overcome.
overcomer_agent.goal: Achieve the global goal: have object b craves object c and object c craves object d.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency across action specifications, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and highlight missing implicit state or assumptions.
Audit responsibilities: detect and remove quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or other bookkeeping artifacts; ensure preconditions and effects are temporally consistent and composable for planning.
Audit output should be a cleaned, consistent set of action schemas and notes, not raw PDDL.
auditor.goal: Produce a causally consistent and bookkeeping-free action specification that other agents and the orchestrator can consume.

private_information: Role: integrate the action specifications from other agents, resolve naming mismatches, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver.
Orchestrator must keep each agent's actions distinct and include typing and requirements appropriate for FastDownward.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the cleaned action specifications and produce a final PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal using FastDownward.

public_information: Actions available in the environment: Attack object; Feast object from another object; Succumb object; Overcome object from another object.
Action semantics summary: Attack requires Province object, Planet object, Harmony; Attack produces Pain and removes Province, Planet, Harmony.
Succumb requires Pain and produces Province, Planet, Harmony and removes Pain.
Overcome requires Province other object and Pain, and produces Harmony, Province object, and Object Craves other object while removing Province other object and Pain.
Feast requires Object Craves other object, Province object, Harmony and produces Pain and Province other object while removing Object Craves other object, Province object, Harmony.
Initial facts: object a craves object d, object d craves object c, harmony is true, planet object b is true, planet object c is true, province object a is true, province object b is true.
Goal statement: make object b craves object c and object c craves object d.

spec.system_prompt: You are an expert in formal action modeling. Produce a clean symbolic specification for the Attack action including parameterized action name, typed parameters, explicit preconditions, positive effects, negative effects, and any implicit assumptions needed for composition. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem. Provide your output as a precise, machine-friendly specification and short explanatory notes.
spec.prompt: Agent: attacker_agent. Use the public information from the environment and your private knowledge to produce a formal action schema for Attack. List parameters, types, preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and any implicit assumptions that are required for this schema to be compositionally valid for planning toward the global goal.

spec.system_prompt: You are an expert in formal action modeling. Produce a clean symbolic specification for the Feast action including parameterized action name, typed parameters, explicit preconditions, positive effects, negative effects, and any implicit assumptions needed for composition. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem. Provide your output as a precise, machine-friendly specification and short explanatory notes.
spec.prompt: Agent: feaster_agent. Use the public information from the environment and your private knowledge to produce a formal action schema for Feast. List parameters, types, preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and any implicit assumptions that are required for this schema to be compositionally valid for planning toward the global goal.

spec.system_prompt: You are an expert in formal action modeling. Produce a clean symbolic specification for the Succumb action including parameterized action name, typed parameters, explicit preconditions, positive effects, negative effects, and any implicit assumptions needed for composition. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem. Provide your output as a precise, machine-friendly specification and short explanatory notes.
spec.prompt: Agent: succumber_agent. Use the public information from the environment and your private knowledge to produce a formal action schema for Succumb. List parameters, types, preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and any implicit assumptions that are required for this schema to be compositionally valid for planning toward the global goal.

spec.system_prompt: You are an expert in formal action modeling. Produce a clean symbolic specification for the Overcome action including parameterized action name, typed parameters, explicit preconditions, positive effects, negative effects, and any implicit assumptions needed for composition. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem. Provide your output as a precise, machine-friendly specification and short explanatory notes.
spec.prompt: Agent: overcomer_agent. Use the public information from the environment and your private knowledge to produce a formal action schema for Overcome. List parameters, types, preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and any implicit assumptions that are required for this schema to be compositionally valid for planning toward the global goal.

audit.system_prompt: You are an expert auditor of temporal and causal consistency for action specifications. Your job is to consume multiple action specifications, identify mismatches, remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalty artifacts, and produce a cleaned, normalized set of action schemas with explicit ordering constraints and notes on unresolved assumptions. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem. Provide a machine-friendly cleaned specification and a short rationale for each change.
audit.prompt: Agent: auditor. You receive the action specifications from other agents. Check for naming mismatches, inconsistent preconditions or effects, hidden tokens or bookkeeping shortcuts, temporal conflicts, and missing implicit state. Produce a cleaned and consistent set of schemas and a short report of fixes and open questions that the orchestrator should consider.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL integration and in producing final PDDL compatible with the FastDownward planner. You must integrate cleaned action schemas from multiple agents, resolve naming and type mismatches, keep each agent's actions distinct by prefixing action names appropriately, and generate a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem designed for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Include appropriate :requirements and :typing declarations for FastDownward and ensure the problem declares all objects, initial facts, and goals consistent with the environment public information.
pddl.prompt: Agent: orchestrator. Integrate the cleaned specifications and audit notes you received. Resolve any remaining naming inconsistencies and produce a final PDDL domain and a final PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Keep actions distinct by indicating which agent authored each action in the action name. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain and problem must implement the initial facts from the environment and the global goal: make object b craves object c and object c craves object d.
